history.content:
I'm pretty sure CS 70 is one of the prereqs for CS 188 and in the new system they check for pre reqs so not sure if you even have the choice to take it this fall, I think you would have to take it spring at the earliest

Yeah, just adding on. CS70 is a prerequisite  for both of the upper div courses in question so even if you could get in, it would be highly recommended that you take them both after CS70.

Edit to above: the new system does not (yet) check for prereqs.

As a ex-TA for CS170, I wouldn't particularly recommend taking it concurrently with CS70, unless you have a strong background with proofs already. If you do, and you have some basic familiarity with modular arithmetic and basic probability, it's probably fine taking the two concurrently.

And now as a ex-TA for CS188, if you aren't very comfortable with probability / manipulating probability expressions, you may have a lot of trouble in the second third of the course, where you're expected to be(come) super comfortable with this. That said, many students who have taken CS70 have forgotten quite a bit / are rusty anyway. But you should definitely look through some probability material beforehand.

children.subject:
Now that I've also TA'd for 188...

Neither class assumes a prereq of the other, but there are many topics that both cover, sometimes under different names (search algorithms like A* vs UCS, dynamic programming vs state space search, Bellman Ford vs Bellman recurrences). This makes taking them at the same time slightly advantageous (looking at the same material in two different ways), but not by a substantial amount, sure.
188 is safe to take with CS 70. But there are not particular synergies between CS 170 and CS188.

history.content: I hear it's recommended to take cs 188 and 170 together. As a rising junior who still hasn't taken upper divs, should I wait until spring to take them together or should I just take 188 this coming fall? I'm gonna be taking cs 70 and math 54 for the fall and then 61c and cog sci 1 in the spring. I've only taken 61a and I'll be taking 61b this summer.
history.subject: cs 188 + 170
